isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC) SYSTEM - ProStar - SYSTEM MAINTENANCE - PRE-SEASON SERVICING

svcproc.title: PRE-SEASON SERVICING
svcproc.para: Experience has shown that many unsatisfactory conditions incurred with heating and air conditioning systems result from lack of regular maintenance. Preventive maintenance and cleanliness of all components within the system are extremely important. A complete step-by-step pre-season checkout of the air conditioner/heater system will substantially increase satisfactory operation during the operating season.

step1.para: Check the mounting fasteners of each component for looseness.
Check condition, tension and alignment of all drive belts. Refer to GROUP 12- ENGINE section in the Master Service Manual.
Check condition of heater hoses and engine cooling system hoses. Replace if necessary.
Verify that the vehicle coolant level is correct.
Check refrigerant hose retention and condition. Look for cracks, chafing, or other damage. Inspect all tubing and hoses for dirty or loose connections. All connections must be clean and tight.

note.para: If a patch of oily residue is found at or near a connection it may indicate a refrigerant leak. Note its location in case a system operational test indicates a refrigerant leak or a low refrigerant condition.
Cleanliness of the air conditioner components cannot be over-emphasized. Lack of proper attention in this area is one of the major causes of costly and unsatisfactory unit operation.

caution.para: Never force the fresh/recirculate air door open. If the door position must be changed; turn on key, set mode control to FLOOR, turn off key. Forcing the door will result in a broken door shaft and a costly repair.

step1.para: Check the filter elements in the evaporator housing and the housing air intake. If the vehicle is equipped with a sleeper HVAC system, check the rear system filter element. Clean or replace filter elements if necessary. To access the filter in the front evaporator housing, refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, AIR FILTER .

caution.para: When using a pressure washer to clean any heat exchanger (radiator, condenser, evaporator, or charge air cooler); use caution and maintain distance from the component with the pressure washer. Do not spray the component fins at an angle as fin damage may occur and reduce efficiency.

step1.para: Clean all foreign material from condenser and radiator fins. As often as necessary, spray water through the condenser towards the radiator and through the radiator towards the condenser to flush debris from the fins. If necessary, spray the component with a cleaning solution, allow to soak 20 - 30 minutes, then rinse with clean water.
Operate front air conditioner system and check operation of controls.
Check operation of front blower (airflow matches selected blower speed).
Verify that the front system is cooling properly in the A/C modes and heating properly in the heat modes.
If the vehicle is equipped with a sleeper HVAC system, proceed to step 14; otherwise, continue to the next step.

Use Diamond Logic Builder (DLB) and the electronic service tool to verify that no HVAC Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTC's) are currently stored in the system. For complete information on viewing DTC's refer to the applicable Electrical Troubleshooting Guide, on ISIS.
If no DTC's are present and the system is operating correctly, the pre-season check is completed.
If the system appears to be malfunctioning refer to the DIAGNOSIS AND TROUBLESHOOTING section .
Verify that the vehicle engine is running.
On the front HVAC control panel, set the blower speed control to midrange, and the mode control to a non-A/C mode.

note.para: In the following steps, bar graphs representing the set points of the blower speed and temperature controls should be displayed in the message display area of the gauge cluster. The bar graphs are displayed only during, and for several seconds after, actuation of the controls. If the vehicle is equipped with a DIGITAL rear HVAC control panel, the bar graphs will also be displayed at that location.

step1.para: Operate the blower speed controls for the sleeper HVAC system (rear control panel and instrument panel switches), and verify that the system responds correctly. Leave the rear blower speed set to mid-range.
Using the sleeper temperature rocker switch on the instrument panel, adjust the temperature set point to its highest setting, and verify that warm air is output from the sleeper vents.

Using the sleeper temperature control on the rear control panel, adjust the temperature set point to its lowest (coldest) setting. Verify that within 2 minutes the A/C compressor is energized and cool air is output from the sleeper vents.

Use Diamond Logic Builder (DLB) and the electronic service tool to verify that no HVAC Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTC's) are currently stored in the system. For complete information on viewing DTC's refer to the applicable Electrical Troubleshooting Guide, on ISIS.
If no DTC's are present and the system is operating correctly, the pre-season check is completed.
If the system appears to be malfunctioning refer to the DIAGNOSIS AND TROUBLESHOOTING section .
